The Network Survey+ app requires a couple permissions to work. Denying these permissions will result in the app not functioning properly. 

1. Access this Device's Location: This app creates a log file which includes the location at which the cellular record was captured. 

2. Access Photos, Media, and Files on Your Device: This permission allows the log file to be written.
The Network Survey+ Service runs when the app needs to do work in the background such as write to the log file or stream data out over active connection

Your MQTT connection settings have been set by a Mobile Device Management server. Toggle the switch below to override those settings so you can specify your own MQTT Broker connection information.

Here you can connect to an MQTT broker. Once connected, all future survey results will be streamed to the server. 

Steps for Connecting: 

1. Enter in the following information: 
 a. The MQTT broker IP Address or Hostname 
 b. The MQTT broker Port Number (Default: 1883 for plain text and 8883 for TLS) 
 c. If the server does not support SSL/TLS, then turn off the TLS toggle switch 
 d. A client id that is used to identify this device on the server 
 e. (Optional) The username and password used to authenticate with the MQTT Broker 

2. Click the connect toggle switch
